markdownRemark.html:
Score: 80

pantagraph.com  (WEB - en-US)

The website of The Pantagraph, a daily newspaper based in Bloomington, Illinois, serving the town and surrounding parts of central Illinois.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

The Pantagraph is owned by Lee Enterprises, a publicly traded media company based in Davenport, Iowa. Lee owns more than 40 daily newspapers across the U.S., including the St. Louis Post-Dispatch.

The site is supported by advertising and subscription fees.

Content

The site publishes local news stories by its reporters, as well as regional, national and international news from the Associated Press, and state news and local news from outlets such as the State Journal Register and the Chicago Tribune.

The site also has sections devoted to sports, entertainment, and opinion, as well as obituaries and classifieds. The site’s editorial board publishes editorials and endorses political candidates. For example, in October 2018, the newspaper endorsed the state’s Republican Gov. Bruce Rauner for a second term.

Credibility

Pantagraph reporters conduct in-the-field reporting, interview sources, and seek comment from the subjects of stories. Opinion content is clearly labeled and differentiated from news content. Headlines accurately reflect the content of stories.

In 2016, the Illinois Press Association awarded The Pantagraph first place in the general excellence category for medium-sized newspapers.

NewsGuard could not find examples of regular corrections posted to the site’s originally produced work.

Transparency

Stories generally have author names attached. A staff directory lists names, titles, email addresses, phone numbers, and sometimes Twitter handles of the paper’s employees and top editors.

The site does not clearly disclose its ownership by Lee Enterprises in a user-friendly way, besides small copyright language at the bottom of the site.

Pantagraph editors did not respond to a total of three emails sent by NewsGuard seeking comment on its corrections policy and its disclosure of ownership.

Advertising is differentiated from editorial content.

History

The Pantagraph’s roots date to 1836 when Bloomington businessman Jesse Fell founded the first version of the newspaper, called The Bloomington Observer and McLean County Advocate.

Lee Enterprises acquired the Pantagraph in 2005.

Written by:
Peter Janecky

Edited by:
Josh Keefe Amy Westfeldt
